sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The cosd function is used to find the cosine of an angle given in degrees. For example, cosd (0) is 1.
sections.text_content: The cosd function is used to find the cosine of an angle given in degrees. For example, cosd (0) is 1.
sections.mdown_content: The **cosd** function is used to find the cosine of an angle given in degrees. For example, **cosd** (0) is 1.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 1 .. 12
            const angle := i * 30
            put "Cos of ", angle, " is ", cosd (angle)
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the cosine of 30, 60, 90, up to 360 degrees.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the cosine of 30, 60, 90, up to 360 degrees.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the cosine of 30, 60, 90, up to 360 degrees.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the sind and tand functions for calculating sine and tangent.

the cos function which finds the cosine of an angle given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the sind and tand functions for calculating sine and tangent.
the cos function which finds the cosine of an angle given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[sind.html](sind)** and **[tand.html](tand)** functions for calculating sine and tangent.

the **[cos.html](cos)** function which finds the cosine of an angle given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
